result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 8th and Operating w/ PAC 8th. The defendant was found guilty of OWI 8th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC 8th was dismissed by the court.

  • David John Ogorzalek was found guilty of OWI 8th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents the DNA Surcharge.

$32.50 represents the cost of the blood draw.  Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment & follow through with recommended treatment
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.    Not to drive with any alcohol in system.
Submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to complete IDIP or its equivalent.

superTimeConds.notes: Defendant to complete 100 hours of community service per year while on extended supervision.

supervisions.notes:
With credit for any administrative suspension.
Concurrent with: with any other revocation currently be served

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license.  However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).
